comments.text: Maybe you're in caret browsing mode. You can turn it off using (fn+)F7.

This happens for me on 67.0b9; Build ID: 20190408123043; User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:67.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/67.0.

I believe this started happening for me when Firefox automatically updated to 67.0b7. Happens on both my desktop and laptop, both running Windows 1809.
comments.raw_text:

comments.text:
(In reply to david.beers from comment #4)
> This happens for me on 67.0b9; Build ID: 20190408123043; User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:67.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/67.0.
> 
> I believe this started happening for me when Firefox automatically updated to 67.0b7. Happens on both my desktop and laptop, both running Windows 1809.

I was stupidly in Caret Browsing mode. I tried that by pressing Fn+F7, but my laptop doesn't have a function on F7, so I just needed to press F7. Thank you!
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to david.beers from comment #4)
> This happens for me on 67.0b9; Build ID: 20190408123043; User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:67.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/67.0.
> 
> I believe this started happening for me when Firefox automatically updated to 67.0b7. Happens on both my desktop and laptop, both running Windows 1809.

I was stupidly in Caret Browsing mode. I tried that by pressing Fn+F7, but my laptop doesn't have a function on F7, so I just needed to press F7. Thank you!

comments.text:
Hi,
It's still happening, even in Troubleshooting mode (writing this comment in Troubleshooting mode).
The cursor's blinking in the weirdest places.
I'm in Big Sur now, but it was the same on Catalina.
Firefox: 89.0.2 (64-bit)
Big Sur: 11.4 (20F71)

Firefox has no key to copy link since 88. It was removed and not replaced. This is completely unreasonable.

A replacement key that is unusable by human hands is not a replacement. It's not unlike telling people they can vote, if they stand in line for 8 hours without water. That is telling people that they can't vote.

Telling people that there is a new key, but it's across the room where NO ONE, NO HUMAN HAND can reach, is telling them that there is no key.

Firefox has NO KEY to copy link currently.

There was no reason to break this, and I want you to know that I am never going to stop reporting it, and I will be identifying the people who broke it, like Asif Youssuff, personally, until it is identified as the bug that it is.

You broke a browser that millions of people depended on for NO REASON. NO REASON. There was NO REASON TO REMOVE THE HOTKEY TO COPY LINKS FROM FIREFOX.
comments.author: daylin.trenton@zooape.net
comments.creator: daylin.trenton@zooape.net
